Description of Output Values

After calling the position-based Online Trajectory Generation (OTG) algorithm with ReflexxesAPI::RMLPosition(), the output values can be read from the class RMLPositionOutputParameters. The output values of the velocity-based Online Trajectory Generation algorithm, which is called with ReflexxesAPI::RMLVelocity() can be read from the class RMLVelocityOutputParameters. For a detailed description of these classes, please refer to the class documentation, and for a description of the input values of the Reflexxes Motion Library, please refer to the Description of Input Values.

This page contains two main sections with one example each:

  1. Output Values of the Position-based Online Trajectory Generation Algorithm (Example)

  2. Output Values of the Velocity-based Online Trajectory Generation Algorithm (Example)

Output Values of the Position-based Online Trajectory Generation Algorithm



Input and output values of the Reflexxes Type IV Motion Library in a generic manner.

The position-based Type IV Online Trajectory Generation algorithm called at a time instant computes the following output values (cf. RMLPositionOutputParameters):

  • The state of motion at time instant consisting of

    • the new position/pose vector RMLPositionOutputParameters::NewPositionVector,

    • the new velocity vector RMLPositionOutputParameters::NewVelocityVector, and

    • the new acceleration vector RMLPositionOutputParameters::NewAccelerationVector.

  • The value of the synchronization time in seconds (RMLPositionOutputParameters::SynchronizationTime), that is, the time which is required until all selected degrees of freedom reach their desired target state of motion .

  • A boolean flag RMLPositionOutputParameters::ANewCalculationWasPerformed, which indicates, what an entirely new computation was performed for the call of ReflexxesAPI::RMLPosition() (cf. Real-Time Behavior).

  • A boolean flag RMLPositionOutputParameters::TrajectoryIsPhaseSynchronized, which indicates, whether the current trajectory is phase-synchronized (cf. Synchronization Behavior).

  • A boolean flag RMLPositionOutputParameters::TrajectoryExceedsTargetPosition, which indicates, whether the desired target position is exceeded before the desired target state will be reached.

  • All data about the positional extremum values that will occur if the motion trajectory is executed. This includes two vectors, which contain the positional extremum values:

    • the minimum positions for each degree of freedom RMLPositionOutputParameters::MinPosExtremaPositionVectorOnly and

    • the minimum positions for each degree of freedom RMLPositionOutputParameters::MaxPosExtremaPositionVectorOnly.

    Furthermore, the times in seconds, at which the positional extremum values are reached, are stored in

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MinExtremaTimesVector and

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MaxExtremaTimesVector.

    As a further addition, it is also possible to read the states of motion of all degrees of freedom that are reached if one degree of freedom is in its positional minimum or maximum:

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MinPosExtremaPositionVectorArray,

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MinPosExtremaVelocityVectorArray,

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MinPosExtremaAccelerationVectorArray,

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MaxPosExtremaPositionVectorArray,

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MaxPosExtremaVelocityVectorArray, and

    • RMLPositionOutputParameters::MaxPosExtremaAccelerationVectorArray.

  • Coefficients of all piecewise polynomials RMLOutputParameters::Polynomials describing the position, velocity, and acceleration progressions of the currently computed trajectory.

  • The currently applied override value RMLPositionOutputParameters::CurrentOverrideValue and a flag RMLPositionOutputParameters::OverrideFilterIsActive to indicate whether the moving average filter for the override input value RMLPositionInputParameters::OverrideValue is still active.
See also:
RMLPositionOutputParameters
Description of Input Values



Example

The position-based Online Trajectory Generation algorithm of the Type IV Reflexxes Motion Library is called by the method ReflexxesAPI::RMLPosition().

In this example (cf. Example 1 — Introduction to the Position-based algorithm), we assume to control a simple Cartesian robot with three translational degrees of freedom, and we apply the following input values at time instant :

Sample trajectory generated by the position-based Type IV Online Trajectory Generation algorithm of the Reflexxes Motion Libraries.


Further examples can be found on pages

  • Synchronization Behavior,
  • About the Flag RMLFlags::PHASE_SYNCHRONIZATION_IF_POSSIBLE, and
  • Behavior after the Final State of Motion is Reached.

For a program to set-up the corresponding input parameters, please refer to Example 2 and its screen output.



Output Values of the Velocity-based Online Trajectory Generation Algorithm



Input and output values of the velocity-based Type IV Online Trajectory Generation algorithm of the Reflexxes Motion Libraries.

The velocity-based Type IV Online Trajectory Generation algorithm is executed by a call of ReflexxesAPI::RMLVelocity(), and its output values RMLVelocityOutputParameters are the very same as for the position-based algorithm (see above), but the values for the target position and the maximum velocity vector are not considered, and the flag RMLPositionFlags::KeepCurrentVelocityInCaseOfFallbackStrategy is not available. The Boolean flag RMLPositionOutputParameters::TrajectoryExceedsTargetPosition is also not provided as the velocity-based onlin etrajectory generation does not require a target position.

See also:
RMLVelocityOutputParameters
Description of Input Values


Note:
The velocity-based algorithm is also used in the second layer of the safety mechanism to guarantee valid output value for any given set of input values (cf. Safety: Three Layers of Error Handling).



Example

For this second example (cf. Example 4 — Introduction to the Velocity-based algorithm), we again assume a very simply Cartesian robot with three translational degrees of freedom.

Sample trajectory generated by the velocity-based Type IV Online Trajectory Generation algorithm of the Reflexxes Motion Libraries.
